content.description: Using thin edges and friction, climb the very blunt, rounded arete.
content.location: Southwest arete of the Buttermilk Stem Boulder, just right of the 'Unnamed' v4 on the West face.

content.description:
Large moves on good slopers.

Stand-start with a left-hand pinch/sidepull under the belly and a right-hand sloper just over it.  Make a big first move to the good sloper straight up above the slanting seam, then work your way up and slightly right to the slab finish.
content.location: West face of the Buttermilk Stem Boulder

content.description: Jump up and grab the deep hueco, then move right to the rounded arete.  Follow this up until the large hueco at its top is reached.   Finish easily from here.
content.location:
4 feet left of

Buttermilk Stem

, on the south face.

content.description: Sit start as for Buttermilk Stem matched on the undercling. Move up the arete and then join Matt's Project going out right.
Stand start at the arete. Traverse right on slopers and a big move to a good hold. Top out on the slab. Not as simple / straightforward as it looks. Fun.

Sit start as for

"Buttermilk Stem Sit Start"

matched on an undercling jug. Pull on and move up the grainy arete using some foot trickery and some high steps and smears. Continue up the arete on vanishing sidepull slopers until you can reach high to a better sloper before finishing up a slab on buckets.
content.protection: 4 pads. The upper section involves a lot of core strength, coordination, and commitment.

content.description: Start with left hand on the arete and right hand on a positive sloper. Work up the arete (heel hooks and right hand sidepulls might prove useful) to a mellow topout.
content.location: Arete to the right of Buttermilk Stem.

content.description: A cool sit start to the already classic Buttermilks Stem problem. Starts matched on the juggy undercling and just pull up and press into the V1. Super fun extra couple moves
content.protection: a pad or two. perhaps a spot

content.description: Sit/squat start far right on an ok left hand crimp and a miserable right hand incut.  Paste your left foot on a good hold and work up the hanging arete via slopers and heel hooks.  Once you get the good left hand pinch reset your feet and make a big move to the good sloper directly above your head.  Top out from here on slopers to easy slab.  Doing just the finishing moves of this problem deserves a V4 I think.
content.location: Far left and around from 'Buttermilk Stem' on the Buttermilk Stem Boulder

content.description:
A must-do for the Buttermilks visitor.

Stand-start with wide palms and make a tricky first move to get your right foot on (crux).  Stem your way up to the good fin and jugs to the easy but great top-out.

Sit-start is considered v4 and requires some creativity/funk.
content.location: South face of the Buttermilk Stem Boulder, right side.

content.description: Squat start as for Brian's Project, but figure out how to mantle straight up. There are a few different sequences that could work. After the initial mantle, finish up the slab on delicate slopers with good footwork.

An excellent route with fun movement and good holds. Start by getting your hand in the big hole by doing a little jump then matching hands, get your feet high and reach left to the little black dot hold, then bump a bit higher, get your foot in the hole, and simply climb to the top.
content.location: South face of the Buttermilk Stem Boulder, starting at the big hole, left of the V2 and the Buttermilk Stem.
